definition: (of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
lit. to practice austerities to become a Daoist immortal/practice makes perfect

sentences.english: In Chinese Mythology, Laojun was in charge of alchemy.
sentences.chinese: 在中國神話裏，太上老君專職修煉仙丹。

sentences.english: Occultism is a general term referring to many branches of thought and practice.
sentences.chinese: 神祕學神祕學是對有關思維和修煉的許多分支的總稱。

sentences.english: After more than one thousand years of cultivation , the spider obtained more spirit.
sentences.chinese: 經過了一千多年的修煉，蛛蛛佛性增加了不少。

sentences.english: So, D dint big uncle, aftertime's your self-discipline cans not stop, either.
sentences.chinese: 所以，丁力大叔，今後的你的修煉也不能停止。

sentences.english: If you do not have to guns and knives into the practice, first to silence is golden.
sentences.chinese: 如果你還沒有修煉到刀槍不入，就先做到沉默是金。

sentences.english: Time noiselessly once rowed in the self-discipline of seven Yans.
sentences.chinese: 時間，在七焰的修煉中悄然劃過。

sentences.english: And what he also eventually make martial real self-discipline of know Xi was what now.
sentences.chinese: 而現在他也終於弄明白習武真正修煉的是什麼了。

sentences.english: I was slowly becoming a real food ninja in the super market.
sentences.chinese: 在超市，我逐漸修煉成了一名真正食物的忍者神龜。

sentences.english: I often piss a puddle to look at my true reflection. In fact, it is a type of conditioning.
sentences.chinese: 自己經常撒泡尿照照自己，其實也是一種修煉。

sentences.english: From then on he just sat silently all day long, facing the wall, practicing "wall contemplation; "Perhaps he was waiting for someone.
sentences.chinese: 從此面壁而坐，終日默默修煉，也許他在等待着誰。

sentences.english: This is the five attitude which every Zhenghong employee must have and keep on practice.
sentences.chinese: 這是成爲一名正弘員工必須持續修煉的五種心態。

sentences.english: Design competitions are about some form of self-improvement.
sentences.chinese: 設計競賽是自我修煉的一些形式，紅警1中文版下載。

sentences.english: To the Yogi everything is bliss.
sentences.chinese: 對於瑜伽修煉者，一切都是天賜之福。

sentences.english: After a thousand years of cultivation, spider Buddha has increased enormously.
sentences.chinese: 經過了一千多年的修煉，蛛蛛佛性增加了不少。

sentences.english: Through ascetic practices, people can become immortals , so they especially value the cultivation of long life.
sentences.chinese: 人通過修煉身體可以成仙，所以他們特別重視養生。

sentences.english: The monks here practise Seon, or Zen Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的和尚修煉的是禪宗佛教。

definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
to come to understand/to realize/consciousness/awareness/Buddhist enlightenment (Sanskrit: cittotpāda)
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to teach/teaching and learning/education/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]
